Package divisioner

Class Divisioner

java.lang.Object
divisioner.Divisioner
public class Divisioner extends Object
Functionality to division AST into positive and negative variability variation points
Author:
Jakub Perdek

    Description
    Divisioner()

    • searchVariationPointPositionsHierarchic

      private void searchVariationPointPositionsHierarchic(org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot, org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent, org.json.simple.JSONObject newAstPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject newAstParent, GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext actualContext, InnerContext parentContext, boolean useTypes) throws NotFoundVariableDeclaration, IOException, InterruptedException, DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint, DuplicatedAnnotation
      Recursive search of variation points
      Parameters:
      astRoot - - the root of processed AST
      astPart - - actually processed AST part
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST part
      newAstPart - - the actually processed AST part from new divisioned AST
      newAstParent - - the parent of actually processed AST part from new divisioned AST
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      actualContext - - the actually processed code context (method or class)
      parentContext - - the parent of actually processed code context (method or class)
      useTypes - - if true then it allows to specify types in the output otherwise not
      Throws:
      NotFoundVariableDeclaration
      IOException
      InterruptedException
      DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint
      DuplicatedAnnotation

    • divisionToVPHierarchic

      public org.json.simple.JSONObject divisionToVPHierarchic(org.json.simple.JSONObject astTreeRoot, String fileName, boolean useTypes) throws NotFoundVariableDeclaration, IOException, InterruptedException, DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint, DuplicatedAnnotation
      Hierarchically divisions variation points according provided AST (TypeScript) -initializes root inner context and global context -launches variation points divisioning - positive and negative variability -outputs ordered structure
      Parameters:
      astTreeRoot - - the root of processed AST
      fileName - - the name of parsed AST
      useTypes - - if types should be used if found during divisioning, especially context/contexts preparation
      Returns:
      divisioned AST (particular code) into variation points
      Throws:
      NotFoundVariableDeclaration
      IOException
      InterruptedException
      DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint
      DuplicatedAnnotation
